summary: This New York Post article discusses the connections and social circles surrounding Jeffrey Epstein, including his relationships with high-profile individuals such as Bill Clinton and Donald Trump. It highlights Epstein's wealth management practices and his rumored acquisition of a mansion from Leslie Wexner. The article also touches on the personal lives of socialites and other figures in Epstein's orbit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is described as a mysterious money manager who has flown high-profile individuals on his private jet and manages substantial wealth for ultra-wealthy clients.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Clinton is mentioned as having flown to Africa on Epstein's private jet, indicating a connection to Epstein.

persons.name: Donald J. Trump
persons.context: Trump is noted for his long-standing friendship with Epstein and comments on their shared interests.

persons.name: Samantha Boardman
persons.context: Boardman is mentioned in relation to her romantic relationships and social life, indicating her connection to the social circles surrounding Epstein.

persons.name: James Truman
persons.context: Truman is mentioned as Boardman's former partner, highlighting the social dynamics within the circles connected to Epstein.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Wexner is described as Epstein's mentor and a client, rumored to have sold a mansion to Epstein for a nominal price.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.context: Tucker is mentioned as one of the high-profile individuals who flew with Clinton on Epstein's private jet.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Spacey is also mentioned as one of the individuals who traveled with Clinton on Epstein's jet.

connections.description: Clinton is noted to have flown on Epstein's private jet, indicating a social connection.
Trump describes Epstein as a friend and mentions their shared interests in women and extravagant living.
Wexner is referred to as Epstein's mentor and a client, indicating a significant professional relationship.
Boardman is mentioned as having previously been in a relationship with Truman.

events.title: Epstein's Connections Revealed
events.description: The article discusses Epstein's social connections and wealth management practices, highlighting his relationships with high-profile individuals.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is described as managing $15 billion for ultra-wealthy clients, only accepting those with at least $1 billion in assets.
Leslie Wexner is rumored to have sold a mansion to Epstein for just $1 after purchasing it for $15,000.
Epstein has flown Bill Clinton, Chris Tucker, and Kevin Spacey on his private jet to Africa.
Donald Trump describes Epstein as a terrific guy and mentions their shared interest in beautiful women.
Samantha Boardman is noted for her social life and relationships, including a breakup with James Truman.
